intro: Maba inconstans var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate maba, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are typically obovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often yellow or greenish in color, and it is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical environments. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
